intro: Couepia amazonica, commonly known as the Amazonian couepia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical rainforests of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus, and is characterized by its showy, pentagonal flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a velvety texture. Couepia amazonica plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various insects and animals.
